main event: A civilian observer reported seeing a chrome-colored, oval-shaped object that moved rapidly and silently in the sky over Auburn, Pennsylvania on March 10, 1967 around 2:10 AM.
interesting points: The object appeared to be about 35 feet wide and the observer was able to cover around 75% of it with a match held at arm's length.
The object moved in a straight line and then dashed away to the left.
The object was described as chrome-colored and mute (no sound).
The observer indicated that the object moved in front of something, possibly a cloud.
The observer estimated the object was over 40 miles away.
